summary: The mailstats utility reads and displays statistics from the sendmail mail transfer agent, providing information about message counts, bytes transferred, and rejection counts per mailer. It parses the sendmail configuration file to identify mailers and locate the statistics file, then outputs formatted statistics data.

logs.reason: Displays usage information when invalid command-line arguments are provided
logs.resolution: Check the command-line parameters and use the supported options as described in the usage message

logs.reason: Indicates an error opening the specified configuration file, followed by the system error message
logs.resolution: Verify that the configuration file exists and has appropriate permissions. The default file is normally /etc/mail/sendmail.cf

logs.reason: The StatusFile path in the configuration file exceeds the maximum allowed length
logs.resolution: Edit the sendmail configuration file and use a shorter path for the StatusFile option

logs.reason: The configuration file defines more mailers than the program can handle (MAXMAILERS)
logs.resolution: Reduce the number of mailers defined in the configuration file or recompile with a larger MAXMAILERS value

logs.reason: No statistics file was found in the configuration (StatusFile option)
logs.resolution: Ensure the sendmail configuration file includes a valid StatusFile option or specify a statistics file with the -f option

logs.reason: The statistics file header doesn't contain the expected magic number, indicating it's not a valid statistics file
logs.resolution: Check if the file has been corrupted or is not a sendmail statistics file. The file may need to be recreated by sendmail

logs.reason: The version of the statistics file format doesn't match the version expected by the mailstats program
logs.resolution: Ensure you're using compatible versions of sendmail and mailstats. You may need to upgrade or downgrade one of them

logs.reason: The size of the statistics file doesn't match what's expected, indicating a format mismatch or corruption
logs.resolution: The statistics file may be corrupted or was created by an incompatible version of sendmail. You may need to reset statistics by truncating the file

logs.reason: Displays the timestamp of when statistics collection began

logs.message_template: M   msgsfr  bytes_from   msgsto    bytes_to  msgsrej msgsdis msgsqur  Mailer
logs.reason: Column headers for the statistics table in human-readable mode
Outputs the start time and current time in program mode (with -P or -p option)
